message.content:
If we assume that the drying time is directly proportional to the number of wet socks, then we can set up a proportion:

Time for 10 pairs to dry = 10 hours (given)
Time for 7 pairs to dry = ? hours
Number of wet socks for 10 pairs = 10 (given)
Number of wet socks for 7 pairs = 7

Let x be the time it takes for 7 pairs of socks to dry. Then:

(10 hours) / (10 pairs) = (x hours) / (7 pairs)

Cross multiplying:

10 * 7 = x * 10

x = (10 * 7) / 10 = 70 / 10 = 7 hours

So, it should take Tom approximately 7 hours to dry 7 pairs of socks under the same weather conditions.
